results.title: Water
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Water is a critical requirement for plant growth. This program examines different methods of watering commercial plants and how to measure water needs scientifically. Water moves from the roots throughout the plant, distributing nutrients and keeping the plant moist. This flow, called transpiration, is driven by diffusion, evaporation and capillary action. The plant uses osmosis to aid this process, and the importance of the Osmotic Gradient in how plants cope with drought, water-logging and salinity is discussed.

results.title: Light
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Photosynthesis is the process by which a plant converts the energy from sunlight into sugars in specialised cells called chloroplasts. Respiration is the releasing of energy stored in sugars in the parts of the cells called mitochondria. The manipulation of light to simulate the natural habitat, shows how plant science can measure the relationship between light level and growth to determine optimum growing conditions.

results.title: Plants and people
results.creator_credit: Robin Wischusen, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
This program examines issues related to commercial farming considering the industry aspects of employment, economic value, the relationship between human dependence on plants and plant production, and the impact of technology. Examines the selective breeding used in the domestication of wheat and the use of genetic biology to provide a wider variety of product.

results.title: Wendy
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Wendy has her pregnancy terminated by abortion and the film reveals some of her reactions, her boyfriend’s and those of her mother to this situation. The film concludes with Wendy emphasising the importance of communications in teenage relationships. Cinemaphotography by Dean Semler. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
A film focusing on a teenage girl in a homosexual relationship. Jenny discusses her perception of the ‘gay’ scene, her relationship and how she feels other people perceive her life-style.

results.title: Weekend
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Looks at the behaviour of a group of young teenagers over what is for them a typical weekend. The focus is on the peer group role in their lives and its significance in shaping expectations the boys and girls have of each other. (Includes footage of John Paul Young performing on stage.)

results.title: Disco
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
This film considers social and sexual expectations and attitudes of teenagers attending a disco. Their perceptions of male and female roles, the similarities and differences are portrayed through their behaviour, conversation and dress. Cinematography by Mike Edols.

results.title: The Prophecies of Nostradamus
results.creator_credit: Antonia Benedek and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Mysteries (Ep 3)”.
In this film, Henry Lincoln breaks through the barriers set up by innumerable interpreters which has obscured the real Nostradamus and reveals what the man himself was like and what he actually wrote.

results.title: Kerry
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Kerry is a fifteen year old girl who leaves home and lives with her boyfriend. She becomes pregnant and returns to her family. The film considers some of the effects that the pregnancy and the decision to keep the baby have on Kerry’s relationship with her family and her boyfriend.
